verses.kjv: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters asswaged;
verses.ct: God turned his attention to Noah and all the wildlife and livestock that were with him in the ark. God sent a wind across the earth, and the waters began to recede.

verses.kjv: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;
verses.ct: The underground springs and the floodgates of heaven were closed, and the rain from heaven was stopped.

verses.kjv: And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.
verses.ct: The waters gradually retreated from the earth, and after 150 days the water level had dropped significantly.

verses.kjv: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.
verses.ct: On the 17th day of the 7th month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.

verses.kjv: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
verses.ct: The waters kept going down until the 10th month, and on the 1st day of the 10th month, the mountain peaks became visible.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:
verses.ct: After 40 days, Noah opened the window he had built into the ark.

verses.kjv: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
verses.ct: He released a raven, and it flew back and forth until the water had dried up from the earth.

verses.kjv: Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;
verses.ct: Then he released a dove to find out whether the water had receded from the surface of the ground.

verses.kjv: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark.
verses.ct: But the dove couldn't find anywhere to land, so she came back to him in the ark, because water still covered the entire surface of the earth. He reached out his hand, caught her, and brought her back inside the ark.

verses.kjv: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;
verses.ct: He waited another 7 days and then sent the dove out from the ark again.

verses.kjv: And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf pluckt off: so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
verses.ct: The dove returned to him that evening, and there in her beak was a freshly plucked olive leaf. That's how Noah knew the waters had receded from the earth.

verses.kjv: And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.
verses.ct: He waited yet another 7 days and sent the dove out once more, but this time she never came back to him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.
verses.ct: By the 1st day of the 1st month of Noah's 601st year, the water had dried up from the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ark and looked out, and the surface of the ground was dry.

verses.kjv: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.
verses.ct: By the 27th day of the 2nd month, the earth was completely dry.

verses.kjv: And God spake unto Noah, saying,
verses.ct: Then God spoke to Noah and said,

verses.kjv: Go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
verses.ct: "Come out of the ark — you, your wife, your sons, and your sons' wives."

verses.kjv: Bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee, of all flesh, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.
verses.ct: "Bring out every living creature that is with you — every kind of bird, animal, and creature that moves along the ground — so they can spread across the earth and be fruitful and multiply on the earth."

verses.kjv: And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him:
verses.ct: So Noah came out, along with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives.

verses.kjv: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark.
verses.ct: Every animal, every creature that moves along the ground, and every bird — everything that moves on the earth — came out of the ark, sorted by their kinds.

verses.kjv: And Noah builded an altar unto the LORD; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
verses.ct: Noah built an altar to the LORD. He took some of every kind of clean animal and clean bird and sacrificed burnt offerings on the altar.

verses.kjv: And the LORD smelled a sweet savour; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake; for the imagination of man’s heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.
verses.ct: The LORD was pleased by the aroma, and the LORD said to himself, "I will never again curse the ground because of humanity, even though the human heart is inclined toward evil from childhood. And I will never again destroy every living thing the way I have done."

verses.kjv: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.
verses.ct: "As long as the earth exists, planting and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night will never stop."
